thag6.12:5.1: For one free of anger, tamed, living in balance,
thag6.12:5.3: a poised one who is at peace,
thag6.12:6.1: When you get angry at an angry person
thag6.12:6.2: you just make things worse for yourself.
thag6.12:6.3: When you don’t get angry at an angry person
thag6.12:6.4: you win a battle hard to win.
thag6.12:7.1: When you know that the other is angry,
thag6.12:7.2: you act for the good of both
thag6.12:7.4: if you’re mindful and stay calm.
thag6.12:9.2: reflect on the simile of the saw;
thag6.12:9.3: if craving for flavors arises in you,
thag6.12:9.4: remember the simile of the child’s flesh.
thag6.12:10.2: to sensual pleasures and future lives,
thag6.12:10.4: as one would curb a greedy cow eating corn.
